Articles.Content:
There is a problem with Visual Enhancement mod. Terrain seems to clip and some windows start to look weird, like the Ctrl+N Setup. As well as framerate drops. This did not happen in pre 24.0 version of the game.

Does anyone encounter this kind of issue or knows how to solve it? Thanks a lot!

To contribute to the debate about how to write a date correctly:

https://xkcd.com/1179/

If you want to easily find KSC without having to mess with your atmosphere: plant flag at end of runway. Set flag as target. Instant nav beacon.

I've used this a few times, but I thought I'd have access to the GUI I vaguely remember using before to adjust the cloud layer settings. But this time around (even though I've found and tried the "GUI = keypress N" in various config files, I can't get the GUI to come up if it's still a thing

EDIT: UGH! Just saw in an above post, that it's CTRL N not just N.... >.< great! Now I know how I SHOULDA been trying to access it, lol =D

*EDIT* Sorry, had multiple tabs open, and posted my question on the wrong one!

Edited September 10, 2014 by Voculus

I recently decided to switch to Linux when playing KSP x64 and while the stability is awesome, I'm having an issue with the Overhaul 9-2 x64 release. As you can see in the photo when in map mode only a thin band of clouds appears around the planet. The band will shift depending on how you pan, tilt and zoom the camera around, but the issue never goes away in map view. Outside of map view at the space center or when piloting a vessel the clouds work like they're supposed to. I'm getting this issue on a clean install of .24.2 x64 for Linux on my Ubuntu install with the Overhaul 9-2 x64 release from the github page. Is this a known issue or is there a way to fix this?

I recently decided to switch to Linux when playing KSP x64 and while the stability is awesome, I'm having an issue with the Overhaul 9-2 x64 release. As you can see in the photo when in map mode only a thin band of clouds appears around the planet. The band will shift depending on how you pan, tilt and zoom the camera around, but the issue never goes away in map view. Outside of map view at the space center or when piloting a vessel the clouds work like they're supposed to. I'm getting this issue on a clean install of .24.2 x64 for Linux on my Ubuntu install with the Overhaul 9-2 x64 release from the github page. Is this a known issue or is there a way to fix this?

http://i.imgur.com/LSfZdMu.jpg

this is a known issue with EVE:Overhaul, and not one just on Linux distros - as of right now, i dont believe anyone has found a way of fixing this with just modifying the config files

Speaking of EVE overhaul, aren't there configs that make this work better with RSS? I seem to recall that you need to multiply the view distance thresholds by 10 or so to be able to see clouds from orbit. Is this true or am I going crazy?
Guys, something's wrong with my clouds...

i dont see anything wrong...

maybe they look a little too grey - wouldnt want Kerbin constantly pestered by storm clouds would we?
i'm rolling on the floor ^o^

Guys, something's wrong with my clouds...

http://cloud-4.steampowered.com/ugc/432652928508721283/7CEB516AA48D9A8B805F819B0EB5A674612597EE/

Not sure if this is a genuine glitch, or if you're trolling. Assume trolling. Still laughing my a$$ off.
Am I weird for wanting astronomer to add that texture to his next release?

Obvious troll is hoping he was obvious. Here's the two textures.

http://i.imgur.com/1lmf040.png

http://i.imgur.com/Kf7qbdH.png

Ya'll just overwrite any of the three cloud files in /GameData/BoulderCo/Clouds with these bad boys.

Guys, something's wrong with my clouds...

http://cloud-4.steampowered.com/ugc/432652928508721283/7CEB516AA48D9A8B805F819B0EB5A674612597EE/

Gonna have to add an "Imgur/Reddit" release now...

I still have to get a Linux install to test.

The "nightlys" should be used for testing, the Overhaul "Releases" have been depricated in favor of a more automated release mechanism.

That being said, the nightlys have an issue like this until I can get time to get it worked out.

Gonna have to add an "Imgur/Reddit" release now...

cool, no worries - good luck @ life

Hi,

I've been using this mod in 0.24.2. When it's installed, I find that it crashes upon save load. When I take out the clouds, however, it works perfectly fine, just no clouds and only city lights. Is there an easy fix for this? I don't really know what's wrong with the clouds...

Thanks.

I've been using this mod in 0.24.2. When it's installed, I find that it crashes upon save load. When I take out the clouds, however, it works perfectly fine, just no clouds and only city lights. Is there an easy fix for this? I don't really know what's wrong with the clouds...

Thanks.

Do you have other mods installed? Sounds like you are running out of memory.

I have something similar, but with OverlayMgr.dll. It loads all the files fine, then starts loading the save and crashes. I took it out of the folder and now it's all fine but I get nothing. No city lights, no clouds. Planets in map view look better tho, but not sure it's this mod that does it. Just in case it matters here's the list of my mods:

KSP in version 0.24.2. Any possibility to fix this? I really need those clouds before I get to Duna :/
as a side note, you should probably get the latest module manager dll, it's up to 2.3.4

I'll do that. Maybe that'll do it?

EDIT: Nope

Edited September 13, 2014 by Serratus

What could be more useful than saying, "I have fifty mods installed, so if that helps, yeah. Please do all the testing and fix it for me." You could remove them and then add them back in until you find a conflict, then let rbay know there is a conflict with THAT mod.
